name: UFC
definition: UFC is the premier brand in combat sports and the driving force behind the sport of MMA.

name: MMA
definition: An abbreviation for mixed martial arts, a combat sport in which athletes from different martial arts disciplines compete.

name: SUBMISSION
definition: When an athlete taps out or verbally concedes the match due to pain, to avoid injury, to avoid being choked out or due to a desire to end the match.

name: TAP OUT
definition: A method in which an athlete submits to his or her opponent by tapping the opponent, themselves, or the mat. Verbal tap outs are also allowed.

name: KNOCKOUT
definition: When an athlete is knocked unconscious due to strikes or other impact.

name: TKO
definition: Abbreviation for technical knockout, when an athlete is unable to continue, usually due to injury.

name: CHOKE OUT
definition: When an athlete is choked until he or she loses consciousness.

name: THE OCTAGON
definition: An octagon-shaped ring in which mixed martial artists compete.

name: DIRTY BOXING
definition: This is in-close boxing from a clinched position. In traditional boxing, athletes would be separated from this position, but in MMA, they are allowed to fight from the clinch.

name: GROUND & POUND
definition: This is a strategy first employed by wrestlers with limited submission skills. It consists of taking an athlete to the ground, placing them in an inferior position and striking until the opponent is knocked out, taps out, or until the match is stopped.

name: GUARD
definition: A semi-defensive position in which an athlete on his or her back keeps an opponent between their legs.

name: OPEN GUARD
definition: A guard position in which the feet are not interlocked.

name: CLOSED GUARD
definition: When an athlete holds an opponent in their guard by interlocking his or her feet behind their opponent.

name: HALF GUARD
definition: A guard position in which only one of the opponent’s legs are held between the grounded athlete’s legs.

name: BUTTERFLY GUARD
definition: An open guard position in which the feet are hooked on the inside of the athlete’s legs.

name: RUBBER GUARD
definition: This is a guard in which the bottom athlete brings one leg high up on the top athlete’s back and hooks the leg under his or her own arm. It controls the top athlete while freeing up one arm for the bottom athlete to attack.

name: GUARD PASS
definition: A technique used by one athlete in another athlete’s guard to move into a mount position.

name: GUARD PASS
definition: A control position in which one athlete is on top of another athlete.

name: SIDE MOUNT
definition: When one athlete is on top of his or her opponent with their heads at 90 degrees. Also known as side control.

name: FRONT MOUNT
definition: A mount position in which the top athlete is squared to the bottom athlete, with his or her legs straddling the opponent.

name: REAR MOUNT
definition: A mount position in which the bottom athlete has his or her back turned to the top athlete.

name: REVERSE MOUNT
definition: A mount position in which the athletes’ heads are facing opposite directions. Also known as North/South Mount.

name: HOOKS IN
definition: When an athlete has a rear mount and locks his or her feet between the legs of the mounted athlete. This prevents the mounted athlete from turning his or her opponent to improve their position.

name: MUAY THAI CLINCH
definition: A clinch position taken from Muay Thai boxing where an athlete will grab his or her opponent behind the head with both hands, using his or her elbows to create distance and apply knee strikes to their opponent.

name: ARMBAR
definition: A lock in which the arm is straightened, hyperextending the elbow. In MMA, this is most often done by trapping the arm between the legs and extending the hips upward.

name: KEYLOCK
definition: An arm-lock applied by the athlete on top where the bottom athlete’s arm is bent at a 90-degree angle. The wrist is held while the other arm wraps underneath and is lifted to apply pressure to the shoulder.

name: KIMURA
definition: An arm-lock position in which the arm is bent behind the athlete leading to an arm break or a shoulder dislocation if the athlete doesn’t tap out. It is named after Japanese athlete, Masahiko Kimura.

name: OMOPLATA
definition: A Kimura lock using the leg, instead of the arm, to trap the athlete’s arm.

name: CHOKE
definition: A submission hold applied to the neck that restricts air flow, blood flow or both. A choke is designed to cause the other athlete to tap out or lose consciousness.

name: GUILLOTINE CHOKE
definition: A choke applied in a reverse headlock position where the forearm is used in an upward manner to apply pressure to the athlete’s neck.

name: REAR-NAKED CHOKE
definition: A choke applied behind an opponent upon capturing his or her back. A rear-naked choke is one of the most advantageous types of chokes as far as positioning.

name: TRIANGLE CHOKE
definition: This choke can be applied using the legs or the arms. Using the arms, the choking athlete drives his or her shoulder into the armpit of their opponent and wraps his or her arm around the opponent’s neck. The athlete then grabs their own hand, arm or head to create pressure. Using the legs, the attacker places the opponent’s neck in the crux of his or her knee while the other leg comes up the opponent’s opposite arm. The foot is hooked under the crux of the other knee, and the hips are raised while the defender’s head is pulled down to create pressure.

name: JAB
definition: A lead-hand strike used to stun.

name: STRAIGHT PUNCH
definition: A punch thrown with the stronger, power hand.

name: OVERHAND PUNCH
definition: A powerful and effective haymaker-style punch that swings up and over.

name: HOOK PUNCH
definition: A punch with the arm bent that is thrown across the body to strike the opponent from the side.

name: UPPERCUT PUNCH
definition: A bent-arm punch where the punch is thrown straight up.

name: LIVER SHOT
definition: A combination between a hook punch and an uppercut thrown to the right side of an opponent. Designed to strike the liver, it’s a painful, often debilitating punch.

name: SUPERMAN PUNCH
definition: An overhead punch in which the athlete leaps at his or her opponent in an attempt to avoid his or her defense.

name: FLYING KNEE
definition: A jumping knee strike designed to penetrate the opponent’s defense.

name: ESCAPE
definition: When an athlete escapes from a submission or choke hold.

name: REVERSAL
definition: When an athlete moves from an inferior position into a superior position.

name: UPA
definition: A roll in which a mounted athlete reverses position, ending in the guard of the other athlete.

name: DOUBLE-LEG TAKEDOWN
definition: Similar to a tackle, an athlete lowers his or her head and hooks both legs with their arms and applies pressure to the defender’s body, driving the opponent to the ground.

name: SINGLE-LEG TAKEDOWN
definition: Similar to a double-leg takedown, except only one leg is hooked.

name: SCISSOR TAKEDOWN
definition: One athlete places their legs on either side of a standing opponent and uses a twisting motion to trip with his or her legs.

name: BODY SLAM
definition: When an athlete picks up his or her opponent and throws them to the ground.

name: SPRAWL
definition: A takedown defense where an athlete spreads their legs away from the attacking athlete and applies their weight to the athlete’s back in an effort to deny access to their legs and attain superior position.
